snippet: Kofi Annan, who also represents the Arab League, said that monitors have helped to ease the violations, but that the peace plan is still in jeopardy.
abstract: Kofi Annan offers a gloomy assessment of the ceasefire he brokered between the Syrian government and the country's opposition forces, saying it could be undermined by continued violations.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: Kofi Annan, who also represents the Arab League, said that monitors have helped to ease the violations, but that the peace plan is still in jeopardy.

headline.seo: Syria Still Violating Cease-Fire, U.N. Envoy Says
headline.main: U.N. Envoy Says Syria Continues to Violate Cease-Fire
headline.print_headline: Syria: Peace Plan at Risk, Annan Warns
